listDocs.name: listDocs
listDocs.label: List Docs

expect.help: Maximum number of docs to return.
expect.name: limit
expect.label: Limit

expect.help: Search term used to filter down results.
expect.name: query
expect.label: Query

expect.help: Show only docs owned by you.
expect.name: isOwner
expect.label: Created by me

expect.help: Show only docs copied from the specified doc ID.
expect.name: sourceDoc
expect.label: Source document ID

listDocs.description: Returns a list of Coda docs accessible by the user. These are returned in the same order as on the docs page: reverse chronological by the latest event relevant to the user (last viewed, edited, or shared).

expect.label: Limit

expect.help: Query used to filter returned rows, specified as `<column_id_or_name>:<value>`. If you'd like to use a column name instead of an ID, you must quote it (e.g., `"My Column":123`). Also note that `value` is a JSON value; if you'd like to use a string, you must surround it in quotes (e.g., `"groceries"`).
expect.name: query
expect.label: Query

expect.help: Use column names instead of column IDs in the returned output.
expect.name: useColumnNames
expect.label: Use column names

listRows.description: Returns a list of rows in a table.

listTables.name: listTables
listTables.label: List Tables

expect.help: ID of the doc.
expect.name: docId
expect.label: Doc ID

expect.help: Maximum number of tables to return.
expect.name: limit
expect.label: Limit

listTables.description: Returns a list of tables in a Coda doc.
listTables.expectJsonc:
[
    {
        "name": "docId",
        "label": "Doc ID",
        "help": "ID of the doc.",
        "required": true,
        "type": "select",
        "options": "rpc://getDocs",
        "mode": "edit"
    },
    {
        "name": "limit",
        "label": "Limit",
        "help": "Maximum number of tables to return.",
        "type": "uinteger",
        "default": 2
    }
]

pushButton.name: pushButton
pushButton.label: Push a Button

expect.help: ID of the doc.
expect.name: docId
expect.label: Doc ID

nested.help: ID or name of the table. Names are discouraged because they're easily prone to being changed by users. If you're using a name, be sure to URI-encode it.
nested.name: tableIdOrName
nested.label: Table ID or Name

nested.help: ID or name of the row. Names are discouraged because they're easily prone to being changed by users. If you're using a name, be sure to URI-encode it. If there are multiple rows with the same value in the identifying column, an arbitrary one will be selected.
nested.name: rowIdOrName
nested.label: Row ID or Name

nested.help: ID or name of the column. Names are discouraged because they're easily prone to being changed by users. If you're using a name, be sure to URI-encode it.
nested.name: columnIdOrName
nested.label: Column ID or Name

pushButton.description: Pushes a button on a row in a table.

upsertRows.name: upsertRows
upsertRows.label: Upsert a Row

spec.help: ID or name of the column.
spec.name: column
spec.label: Column ID or Name

nested.help: Column IDs or names to use as upsert keys for matching rows to update. Omit for insert-only operations.
nested.name: keyColumns
nested.label: Key columns

upsertRows.description: Creates a new row or updates existing rows if any upsert key columns are provided. When upserting, if multiple rows match the specified key column(s), they will all be updated with the specified value.

MakeAPICall.name: MakeAPICall
MakeAPICall.label: Make an API Call

expect.help: Enter a path relative to `https://coda.io/apis`. For example: `/v1/docs`.
expect.name: url
expect.label: URL

expect.help: You don't have to add authorization headers; we already did that for you.
expect.name: headers
expect.label: Headers

MakeAPICall.description: Performs an arbitrary authorized API call.

watchNewDocs.name: watchNewDocs
watchNewDocs.label: Watch Docs

parameters.help: Check only for docs created by you.
parameters.name: isOwned
parameters.label: Created by me

parameters.help: The maximum number of results to be worked with during one execution cycle.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.label: Limit

watchNewDocs.description: Triggers when a doc is created or updated.

watchNewRows.name: watchNewRows
watchNewRows.label: Watch New Rows

parameters.help: The maximum number of results to be worked with during one execution cycle.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.label: Limit

watchNewRows.description: Triggers when a new row is created in selected table.

watchUpdatedRow.name: watchUpdatedRow
watchUpdatedRow.label: Watch Updated Rows

parameters.help: The maximum number of results to be worked with during one execution cycle.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.label: Limit

watchUpdatedRow.description: Triggers when an existing row is updated in selected table.

resolveBrowserLink.name: resolveBrowserLink
resolveBrowserLink.label: Resolve Browser Link

expect.help: The browser link to try to resolve.
expect.name: url
expect.label: Url

expect.help: By default, attempting to resolve the Coda URL of a deleted object will result in an error. If this flag is set, the next-available object, all the way up to the doc itself, will be resolved.
expect.name: degradeGracefully
expect.label: Degrade gracefully

resolveBrowserLink.description: Given a browser link to a Coda object, attempts to find it and return metadata that can be used to get more info on it.

prepareColumns.name: prepareColumns

description: Automate data flows between Coda and Google Drive, Gmail, Telegram Bot, ClickUp and more apps. Back up, share, inform, duplicate. With {{integromat}}, there's no limit to what you can do!
